intro: Randia lachnosiphonium, commonly known as the roughleaf randia, is a shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and small, white to pinkish flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, elliptical seeds. Randia lachnosiphonium is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
